BodyName: Committee on Consumer Affairs and Business Licensing

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to allowing a food service establishment surcharge, and to repeal local law number 100 for the year 2020, relating to a COVID-19 recovery charge.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Allowing a food service establishment surcharge, and to repeal local law number 100 for the year 2020, relating to a COVID-19 recovery charge.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring third-party food delivery services and third-party courier services to provide food delivery workers with insulated food delivery bags, and authorizing the commissioner of the department of consumer and worker protection to deny, suspend, revoke or refuse to renew a license for violations of chapter 15 of title 20 of such code
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Requiring third-party food delivery services and third-party courier services to provide food delivery workers with insulated food delivery bags, and authorizing the commissioner of the department of consumer and worker protection to deny, suspend, revoke

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to establishing general provisions related to working conditions for third-party service workers and requiring that third-party food delivery services permit delivery workers to set limitations on distance and route for deliveries
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Establishing general provisions related to working conditions for third-party service workers and requiring that third-party food delivery services permit delivery workers to set limitations on distance and route for deliveries.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to establishing minimum per trip payments to third-party food delivery service and third-party courier service workers
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Establishing minimum per trip payments to third-party food delivery service and third-party courier service workers.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to establishing standards for payment of food delivery workers
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Establishing standards for payment of food delivery workers.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the agreements between third-party food delivery services and food service establishments and the provision of toilet facility access to food delivery workers
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Agreements between third-party food delivery services and food service establishments and the provision of toilet facility access to food delivery workers.

Items.Title: Oversight - Protections for Delivery Workers
Items.ActionText: This Oversight was Hearing Held by Committee

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to data on orders placed through third-party food delivery services
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Data on orders placed through third-party food delivery services.

Items.Title: Oversight - Protections for Delivery Workers
Items.ActionText: This Oversight was Filed, by Committee

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to allowing a food service establishment surcharge, and to repeal local law number 100 for the year 2020, relating to a COVID-19 recovery charge.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Laid Over by Committee
